The input is null.  This is happening due to PartInitException leaving phantom
editors in the workspace.  In the interest of robustness, it might be an idea to
add a null check.

See bug 89246 for the PartInitException.
A point fix went into MarkerView.focusSelectionChanged for bug 88965, but it
would be better to have ResourceUtil do the null check.
In the old pattern, if (input instanceof IFileEditorInput) ..., it would work OK
(evaluate to false) if input was null.  ResourceUtil.getFile(input) != null
should be just as "safe".

I've added a null check to ResourceUtil.getFile and getResource.
*** Bug 91691 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message: No saved state can be found for editor id= name=<null>
